> I don't think they will release it in 10 days but maybe a release date. There's not enough hype yet outside the KSP community and 10 days is too short to get people's attention unless they don't aim for a big 1.0 release with fireworks and everything.

So let me get this straight, you think they are going to do a countdown to a release date in the future? They said it would be a longer experimentals and by the 27th it will be more than 2 weeks (they also said the experimentals were going swimmingly).

What is the benefit of a countdown to announce a release date? Wouldn't it be more beneficial to say the release date now an get the hype rolling?

I bet all next week is gonna be buildup to the 27th.

I wish I had a good picture of the HypeTrain 07A in superflight on her way to 1.0! 

How about a little contest?

If someone can create a picture of a green-colored Gresley A1/A3 locomotive from the LNER (Such as the Flying Scotsman) with markings on the side consistent with the one in the OP of this thread, but make it look like it is going fast, that will be the official HypeTrain picture!

> 
> I'm happy about this. No more command chair Eve ascent cheesiness.

I don't think so. I mean, if you keep it at terminal velocity you shouldn't die (People fall at terminal velocity all the time and - providing their chutes open - they generally come out of it okay). Also, Eve ascent will hopefully be a bit easier from a dV perspective so chair shenanigans should be far less attractive compared to something aerodynamic.
